cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the Art Gallery Problem, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. The problem involves finding a minimum set of guards to cover a simple polygon, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The algorithm presented in the paper uses ideas from previous work on the problem, which involves data structures (cs.DS) and approximation algorithms (cs.DM). The problem is also related to graph theory (cs.CC) and game theory (cs.GT), as it can be formulated as a graph problem and has connections to the concept of domination in games.
